Module simplifier
Package ie.gmit.dip

Class StringColourConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • ie.gmit.dip.AbstractStringConverter
      • ie.gmit.dip.StringColourConverter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AbstractConverter<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String>
    public class StringColourConverter
extends AbstractStringConverter
    StringColourConverter is a concrete class which extends the abstract base class AbstractStringConverter. Its primary responsibility is to modify the color of a String when printing it to a terminal window. It does so by prepending and appending the appropriate ANSI codes, which are provided/set as String types.
    Since:
    JavaSE-11
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Kieran P. Somers
    See Also:
    AbstractStringConverter

        Parameters:
        startColor - defines the ANSI format String which sets the color at the beginning of the String to be converted.
        endColor - defines the ANSI format String which sets the color at the end of the String to be converted.
